question: What is Nano and how does it work?
expected_answer: Nano is a decentralized, feeless cryptocurrency that uses a block-lattice structure to enable fast transactions. More details: https://docs.nano.org/what-is-nano/overview/

question: How do I run a Nano node?
expected_answer: To run a Nano node, you need to install the Nano node software and sync with the network. Full guide: https://docs.nano.org/running-a-node/overview/

question: What is Proof-of-Work in Nano?
expected_answer: Nano uses Proof-of-Work (PoW) as an anti-spam measure rather than for consensus. Details: https://docs.nano.org/protocol-design/proof-of-work/

question: How do I send a transaction in Nano?
expected_answer: To send a transaction in Nano, use a wallet that supports Nano and broadcast the transaction to the network. Guide: https://docs.nano.org/integration-guides/sending-transactions/

question: Where can I find the RPC commands for Nano?
expected_answer: Nano provides an RPC interface for interacting with the network. Full list of commands: https://docs.nano.org/commands/rpc-protocol/
